results.title: Beds and appliances
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Care of the sick and injured”.
This film, produced by the U.S. Navy, demonstrates how to make and manipulate beds for the sick and injured (particularly those bedridden for extended periods of time) so that the patient’s comfort is increased and their recovery is thereby quickened. Demonstrates how to make a bunk as well as a bed in a ward so that the bedclothes do no need adjusting during the day, and also includes handy tips for materials which can be used to improvise elevations and inclines to vary a patient’s position in bed. No other credits available.

results.title: Giving oral medications
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Care of the sick and injured”.
Stresses the importance and demonstrates the correct procedure for giving the right amount of the right medicine at the right time to the right patient.

results.title: Giving an enema
results.creator_credit: United States. Dept. of the Navy
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Care of the sick and injured”
Discusses two main types of enemas, retention and evacuant, and demonstrates the procedure for giving them. Emphasises the importance of after-care of the patient and sterilization of equipment.

results.title: Temperature, pulse and respiration
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Care of the sick and injured”
Demonstrates how to take the pulse, temperature, and respiration explaining how to accomplish these tasks methodically and pointing out the location where the pulse beat may be heard.

results.title: Isolation technique
results.creator_credit: Willard Pictures and United States. Dept. of the Navy
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Care of the sick and injured”.
Demonstrates how to perform medical aseptic techniques when caring for a patient with a communicable disease. Shows how to set up an isolation unit; how to organise the work; when and when not to wear the isolation gown and mask; how and when to wash the hands; how to remove and clean items used in the unit. Concludes with a short summary of basic principles to be observed when caring for a patient in isolation.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Willard Pictures and United States. Dept. of the Navy

results.title: The N.P. patient = The Neuro psychiatric patient
results.creator_credit: Bureau of Aeronautics and United States. Dept. of the Navy
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Care of the sick and injured”.
A training film designed to help naval hospital staff deal with and help sailors with various psychiatric and behavioral problems, ie the neuro-psychiatric patients.

group_works.title: Capitalism
group_works.creator_credit: Yves Gerard Issembert, Sidney Platt and National Geographic Society

results.title: Capitalism
results.creator_credit: Yves Gerard Issembert, Sidney Platt and National Geographic Society
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Capitalism, socialism, communism”.
A general introduction to capitalist economies. The video traces the development of the market economy in late 17th Century Britain, where colonial expansion and the beginning of industrialisation saw the rise of the merchant and labouring classes. The video offers an introduction to the “laissez-faire” economic theories of Adam Smith which argue for a completely deregulated market with no government intervention. The experience of the Great Depression, however, is highlighted to indicate the limits to deregulation and to explore the tension in capitalist societies between satisfying the needs of the market and the needs of human beings.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Yves Gerard Issembert, Sidney Platt and National Geographic Society

results.title: Canoeing safely
results.creator_credit: Maurice Dybeck, Peter Halket and Explorer Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Canoecraft”.
Underlines some of the dangers which abound on almost every river and canal and shows ways of taking sensible precautions to avoid these dangers. Topics covered include life; hazards; paddling skills; an ‘H’ rescue; canoe buoyancy aids; weirs; capsize drill; stopper waves; emergency packs; bridges and a ‘T’ rescue.
